POSITION SUMMARY
The Chemical/Fuel Technician is responsible for the overall safe, reliable and efficient management of the power plant water chemistry and related issues in accordance with industry standards, environmental restrictions, original equipment manufacturers recommendations, and standard operating procedures as directed by the chemical/fuel leader.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
Duties and responsibilities for this position include but are not limited to the following:
• Monitor the quality of all plant water systems and identify and administer treatment as required to ensure that facility equipment life, operational efficiency and environmental compliance is maintained. This includes demineralizers, electro-chlorinating and wastewater treatment plants boiler, turbines and related auxiliaries. 
• Conduct testing to ensure coal and other fuel meets contracted standards. 
• Monitor boiler water chemistry to assure consistent water quality and takes an action to ensure that maximum permissible limits are not exceeded. 
• Conduct water and fuel sampling and tests.
• Monitor coal specification to ensure is within boiler design specifications. Promptly advise the Chemical/Fuel Engineer of any deviation from specification which could adversely impact operation of the boilers.
• Assist Chemical/Fuel Leader to monitor fuel chemistry to ensure it is within boiler design specifications.
• Assist the Chemical/Fuel Leader to develop, implement and direct the policy, procedures and practices required for the safe, efficient and reliable operation of the power generation systems and equipment. Provide technical assistance in interpreting laboratory test results, and advice on impact of test results to the plant operation.
• Assist the Chemical/Fuel Leader to manage and supervise the O&M contractor of Coal Handling system.
• Assist the Chemical/Fuel Leader to organize strategies on coal yard utilization, plant operating guidelines, coal movement and coal spacing.
• Support Chemical/Fuel Leader to establish and maintain Chemical/Fuel systems operations data recordkeeping, including operating logs, trend logs, chemistry logs, and reports pertaining to environmental regulations and operations.
• Perform additional duties as required.

title: Sous Chef

• Directly checking the quality of purchased food & material/ trực tiếp kiểm tra chất lượng thực phẩm đầu vào.
• Directly checking the spoiled foods and provide a treatment solution / Trực tiếp kiểm tra các loại thực phẩm bị huỷ và đưa ra phương án xử lý.
• Manage the food and material storage, ensuring the use of alternate food according to the first in, first out principle / Quản lý việc sử dụng thực phẩm, bảo đảm sử dụng thực phẩm luân phiên theo nguyên tắc nhập trước, xuất trước

• Checking & monitoring the daily food inventory report/ Kiểm tra và giám sát báo cáo xuất nhập tồn hàng ngày của bếp
• Checking dishes to making sure all the dishes are well presentation and good quality before serving to customer / Kiểm tra chất lượng, hình ảnh món ăn trước khi ra đồ.
• Control implementation process to ensure food hygine & safety standards/ Kiểm soát quy trình thực hiện để đảm bảo tiêu chuẩn VSATTP
• Controlling food order from restaurant and assign staff to making accordingly/ Kiểm soát order món ăn từ nhà hàng và phân bổ công việc để làm đúng theo order
• Supporting Head Chef in building menus, planning for food development/ Hỗ trợ bếp trưởng trong việc làm thực đơn, lên kế hoạch, định hướng phát triển món ăn
• Making & Organizing the regular deep cleaning schedule for kitchen, tools and utensils/ Lên kế hoạch và trực tiếp chỉ đạo việc vệ sinh bếp và công cụ dụng cụ định kỳ.
• Ensuring strict adherence and compliance with all laws and regulations/ Đảm bảo tuân thủ và làm đúng theo luật lệ và quy định
• Replacing Head Chef during his/ her absence/ Đảm nhiệm công việc của Bếp Trưởng trong suốt thời gian Bếp Trưởng vắng mặt
• Making daily report to Head Chef in term of kitchen operation/ Báo cáo hàng ngày cho Bếp Trưởng về công việc vận hành bếp
• Performing other tasks from time to time as reasonably requested by Head Chef/ Thực hiện các công việc khác theo yêu cầu hợp lý của Bếp Trưởng.
• Coordinating with Head Chef to developing food and beverage concepts & products / Phối hợp với Bếp Trưởng để phát triển ý tưởng ẩm thực
• Organizing and executing annual and seasonal food and beverage promotion plans/ Tổ chức và thực hiện các chương trình xúc tiến thương mại đồ ăn và đồ uống theo mùa và hàng năm.
• Making daily kitchen inspections and taking corrective actions as necessary/ Thực hiện việc kiểm tra các khu vực bếp hàng ngày và có biện pháp khắc phục kịp thời khi cần thiết
• Directly participated to cooking & processing the food in the kitchen/ Trực tiếp tham gia việc nấu nướng và chuẩn bị đồ ăn cho phục vụ
• Controlling and reducing waste, breakage or loss/ Kiểm soát và hạn chế việc lãng phí, đổ vỡ hoặc thất thoát.
• Conlect & record all document related to food receiving process/ Tập hợp và lưu trữ các phiếu xuất nhập tồn của bếp
• Assisting Head Chef in Implementation, control and maintenance of HACCP standards and procedures/ Thực hiện, kiểm soát và duy trì các tiêu chuẩn và nguyên tắc VSATTP.
• Motivating of employees and ensuring employees’ health, safety, security and welfare at all times/ Luôn luôn thúc đẩy nhân viên bếp và đảm bảo về tình trạng sức khỏe, an ninh, an toàn và phúc lợi cho nhân viên
• Monitoring and evaluating staff’s performance and motivation/ Theo dõi và đánh giá sự thể hiện và sự tiến bộ của nhân viên bếp
• Conducting regular employee trainings/ Thực hiện đào tạo định kỳ cho nhân viên
• Resolving any internal conflicts amicably/ Giải quyết các mâu thuẫn nội bộ.
• Attending weekly & daily kitchen meetings/ Tham gia vào các buổi họp của bộ phận bếp hàng ngày và hàng tuần.
• Implementing management policies/ Thực hiện các chính sách quản lý
• Assist Head Chef in checking daily figures against budget targets/ Hỗ trợ Bếp Trưởng kiểm tra số liệu hàng ngày so với mục tiêu ngân sách.
• Implementing and maintaining standard operational procedures/ Thực hiện và duy trì các quy trình vận hành tiêu chuẩn
• Monitoring quality and taking corrective actions where necessary/ Theo dõi chất lượng và có hành động điều chỉnh kịp thời khi cần thiết
• Ensuring excellent and consistent customer service/ Đảm bảo chất lượng phục vụ đạt tiêu chuẩn và đồng nhất
• Achieving highest guest satisfaction/ Mang đến cho khách hàng sự hài lòng tốt nhất

title: Head of HR
job_description:
My client seeks a Head of HR to elevate their HR function to strategic heights while ensuring foundational HR support for the company's overall growth. The Head of HR will serve as a critical business partner, collaborating closely with the Senior Leadership Team of the Company to drive organisational performance through strategic people management, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation. Reporting directly to the GM.


Description

* Architect the overarching HR and People strategy, closely aligning with global directives while addressing local nuances & priorities.
* Craft a robust Talent Acquisition strategy that focuses on attracting the best candidates, streamlining the recruitment processes & refining the selection methods including for the Field forces, training our Hiring Managers, boosting our Employer Branding, and ensuring a top-notch onboarding experience.
* Initiate a forward-thinking approach to address retention challenges, devising a comprehensive plan aiming at not only retaining our people but also fostering their development and growth over the long term. This strategy should encompass innovative retention techniques tailored to our company's unique culture and objectives, ensuring our talents feel valued and motivated to contribute to our continued success.
* Craft a transformative People Engagement strategy to elevate our workplace, making it conducive & safe - emphasizing a deep commitment to our team, environmental stewardship, and ethical practices.
* Craft & implement a learning and development strategy that aligns with our corporate goals, for our Head-office staff, and with a specific focus on the Field forces. This entails fostering a culture of continuous improvement and tailoring development programs to both individual and organizational needs. The aim being for our staff to remain agile and well-equipped to meet future challenges, promoting personal growth and maintaining our competitive edge.
* Drastically improve our HR processes, practices & policies - revamping them to mirror our global ethos while adhering to local regulations, enhancing the HR efficiency and ensuring our operations are both strategic and compliant.
* Strategically partner with the GM and Finance team to design the annual Budget & complete the Rolling Forecast - with continuous monitoring throughout the year. Also, take a strategic approach to HR analytics, transforming data into actionable insights through management reports that effectively guide organizational decisions and track crucial HR performance metrics.


Profile

The candidate excels in developing and executing strategies, with a strong ability to implement practical action plans thanks to his/her hands-on approach and proactive mindset.
* The candidate shows significant potential for growth, demonstrates agility in learning and adaptation, and possesses a high ambition for leading HR transformation, underpinned by a results-driven and entrepreneurial spirit.
* With excellent business acumen, the candidate stands out for his/her capacity to work closely with the rest of the Leadership team / the other departments. S/he bolsters the team's capabilities in managing people and leadership, steering them towards their business targets through effective HR strategies.
* The candidate is well-versed in HR market trends, practices and regulations.
* The candidate is adept in international contexts, skilled at engaging with teams across APAC & Global, and possesses a keen interest to contributing to and implementing regional/global projects locally, showcasing a strong collaborative spirit.
* The candidate effectively personifies and promotes the Company's corporate culture and ethics, upholding the utmost integrity and setting a strong example within the organization.
Education & hard skills
* Degree in Human Resources;
* At least 10 years of working experience, handling the full spectrum of HR activities in complex settings;
* Previous experience of People management required;
* Proven track record of successful HR transformation - revamping all the existing processes, supporting organizational evolutions, and boosting the overall People & leadership capabilities across the organization.
* Demonstrated success in reducing employee turnover, with a strong emphasis on fostering talent development and enhancing performance management strategies.
* Strong knowledge of labor laws and sound understanding of the market;
* Tech savvy, with experience in working with HRIS, and advanced excel skills - to enable and encourage reliance on data and reporting in order to support the strategy and business objectives;
* Ability to multi-task in a fast pace environment;
* Analytical mind & strategic thinking, strong problem-solving and decision-making aptitude.
* English is a must.
Personal skills
* Strong ethics and reliability
* Strong EQ with high level of humility, and openness to receive feedbacks
* Excellent communication with good leadership
* Positive & constructive attitude at all time
* Enthusiastic individual with high level of self-motivation, commitment & engagement
* Good strategic thinking abilities as well as being a do-er
* Meticulous & details minded
* Agile & fast learner
* Creative & innovative mindset
* Good coaching capabilities
* Strong results-orientation
* Great team player with the ability to work very closely with the other departments
* International mindset, open-minded


Job Offer

Competitive Package & Career progression.


Page Group Vietnam is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

- Giám sát quá trình thi công.
- Theo dõi, kiểm soát chất lượng và khối lượng thi công.
- Kiểm tra, đánh giá năng lực đội ngũ thi công.

- Tham gia các cuộc họp và báo cáo công việc định kỳ cho cấp trên.
- Theo dõi các công việc phát sinh tại dự án.

job_description:
RMIT University Commitment 
RMIT is committed to the rights of students and staff to be safe, respected, valued, and treated as an equal in their place of study and work. All staff are expected to share this commitment and contribute to a safer community. While carrying out their role, staff are in a position of trust with students. Staff have a duty of care to report wellbeing concerns about students through the designated channels and uphold to the code of conduct. RMIT Vietnam expects all staff members to comply with its Code of Conduct, policies and procedures, which relate to legal and regulatory requirements and our ways of working.

Why RMIT University Vietnam 
RMIT Vietnam is committed to excellence, innovation, and social responsibility. We welcome applications from qualified and passionate individuals who share our values and vision. RMIT University has a global reputation and ranks 140th globally and 11th in Australia in QS World University Rankings 2024. To learn more about our rankings, please check out our latest facts and figures here Reputation and rankings - RMIT University 

Rewards and Benefits:
- Competitive VND salary (plus allowances) starting from VND19,233,000 depending on proven track record in meeting all the key selection criteria.
- 13th month Tet bonus + private medical insurance (for you and your dependents) + annual health check.
- Generous annual leave, career leave and public holidays (Christmas and Tet Holidays)
- Professional development and career advancement
- Access to state-of-the-art facilities and resources
- A vibrant and diverse campus life and more!

RMIT Vietnam has been honoured with the respectable HR Asia Award as Top Employer To Work For in Asia. To find out more about RMIT Vietnam and our current vacancies, please visit our website: https://www.rmit.edu.vn/careers

Your role 
This position provides administration for all functions in the School of Science, Engineering & Technology, including administration assistance and academic related administration activities for the Program Manager and Senior Program Managers. This role will include financial management such as purchasing, event organizing and administrative assistance to the Senior Coordinator, Academic Advisory & Planning.

Reporting line 
Reports to: Senior Coordinator, Academic Advisory & Planning

Key accountabilities
- Arrange and schedule School or Program specific meetings and Program areas correspondence in a timely manner.
- Maintain accurate records on course and program administration particularly for the purposes of program accreditation. This includes accessing, management and reporting of data in the academic management system (SRS)/SAMS Up.
- Coordinate the assignment of activities by SSET Academic Administration Officers such that all activities in the School receive the needed support to meet deadlines at the highest quality and to ensure a high-quality student experience consistent with the requirements of RMIT University policies and procedures, ensuring compliance at all times to internal frameworks.
- Provide guidance and support to students on any issue raised and/or arrange meetings with appropriate academic or persons at other university support services. Advice, and information provided to students is current to the relevant university global policy and local and global procedures. (E.g. assessment policy).
- Provide administrative support across the School for event such as Experience Days, Student Orientation, Information Days, Industry Advisory Committee meetings, promotion sessions and other externally focused events concerning the School of Science, Engineering & Technology.
- Travel arrangements: organize all work travel arrangements for staff within the programs, including itineraries, airfares, accommodation and transportations.
- Support School Manager and/or Senior Coordinator, Academic Advisory & Planning in term of contract preparation, purchasing documentation, identification of and negotiation with preferred service providers and vendors when required.
- Support the effective communication between relevant SSET staff at RMIT Vietnam and RMIT Melbourne.
- Other duties as requested by the Senior Coordinator, Academic Advisory & Planning or SSET Leadership team.
requirements:
Key selection criteria 
1. A relevant Bachelor degree
2. At least one year of experience in a similar customer service-related role.
3. Familiarity and working knowledge of finance related admin work is essential for this position.
4. Familiarity or working knowledge of developing and managing promotional and/or marketing related materials and activities.
5. Experience in providing financial management support upon request
6. Excellent interpersonal skills, including cross cultural communication
7. Demonstrated ability to work with confidential information.
8. Experience in managing purchasing, developing budgets, financial reporting is desirable.
9. Experience in writing reports for executive management is desirable.
10. Ability to display appropriate behaviours in line with the position, as per the RMIT Behavioural Capability Framework (Connectedness, Commitment to Excellence – Improve and Simplify; Imagination and Innovation; Impact; Inclusion; Agility).

English proficiency requirement 
English is the language of teaching and communication at RMIT Vietnam. For this role, the minimum requirement is IELTS (General) with a score of at least 6.0 (or equivalent, as outlined in the Recruitment and Selection Guidelines).

title: Senior Demand Planner
job_description:
This role belongs to Supply Chain Department of PNJ Head Office. You will be a part of a dynamic, specialized and tech-savvy team. Please be assured you will join an exciting career journey with a very high-complex Supply Chain model in the market.

The job holder will report to Demand Planning Manager.
We also open new roles for Senior Supply Planner, Senior Demand Analyst and other roles for the expansion and growth of the Supply Chain Division.

WHAT YOU DO

1/ Build forecasting models and supply planning (35%)
• Collect information, data on business performance of the whole group based on sales data, sales promotion information and historical sales data
• Develop forecasting models for market insights by regions, categories, product lines, product groups.
• Work closely with Supply Planning Department to ensure an optimal stock levels to meet the forecasting demands and tackle issues relating to out of stock / overstock

2/ Analyze forecasting results (30 %)
• Analyze forecasting results under various scenarios to establish KPIs and business metrics.
• Forecast and alert market risks while analyzing business trends by month/quarter/year and regions

3/ Improve forecasting activities and build the supply planning (15%)
• Monitor the stability of the models and implement appropriate improvements or changes.
• Conduct in-depth analysis and define root causes

4/ Collaboration across department (20%)
• Collaborate with other departments, including R&D, System Development, Sales, and Marketing, to synthesize information and create the most accurate data source.
• Participate in the company's Sales and Operations Planning (S&OP) process.
• Provide forecasting data for departments within Supply Chain and other departments within the group.
requirements:
WHAT WE NEED
• Bachelor or higher degree in relevant majors
• Fluency in English (reading comprehension of specialized documents)
Experience and skills required:
• From 03 years of relevant experiences
• Soft skills: communication and presentation
• Data analysis: Power BI, SQL (mandatory) and SQL (preferred).

WHAT YOU WILL ENJOY
· A high-complex and specialized Supply Chain model
· Competitive performance bonus scheme
· Exposed to a tech-savvy, continuous-learning environment (Power BI, Python, SQL and more)
· Other competitive benefits and opportunities to join diversified social activities (ESG, CSR etc.) of the group

title: Office Administrator
job_description:
JOB OVERVIEW
As the Office Administrator at SEADEV, your role will involve overseeing the general office management, including administrative tasks, correspondence, and phone calls. You'll also manage external and government relations, handle paperwork processing, and assist in event planning. Additionally, you'll be responsible for providing administrative support across various departments and managing and purchasing office facilities, and devices to ensure they are well-maintained. Your contribution will be essential in maintaining efficient operations and supporting the needs of our team.

WHAT WILL YOU DO?
● General Facilities Management:
● Oversee day-to-day office operations, including managing office supplies, equipment maintenance, and workspace organization.
● Ensure the office environment is clean, safe, and conducive to productivity.
● Implement and maintain office policies and procedures to streamline operations.
● Purchase and manage office supplies, equipment, and facilities for uninterrupted function, identify needs and acquire supplies, manage vendor relationships.
● Generating and managing contracts with suppliers / customers in relation to administrative activities.
● Liaising between the company and third-party vendors and service providers.
● External/Government Relations:
● Manage incoming calls, visitors, email, and direct inquiries to the appropriate departments.
● Liaise with external stakeholders and government offices for paperwork processing and other administrative matters.
● Event Planning: Assisting in planning and running company events and team activities.
● Performing other ad-hoc assignments from the Supervisor.
requirements:
WHAT DO YOU NEED?
● Bachelor's degree in business administration, hospitality, or related field.
● Fluency in English (writing, speaking, listening, reading).
● Proven 2-3 years working experience in Office Administration, Assistant, Event Management, or Customer Service roles.
● Detail-oriented with a service-oriented mindset, and a proactive and dynamic approach to tasks.
● Ability to work independently and collaboratively as part of a team.
● Outstanding abilities to communicate in person, in writing and over the phone and interpersonal abilities.
● Strong organizational, problem-solving skills.
● Experience in purchasing and reporting.
● Proficiency in Google Products (Docs, Sheets, Drive, etc.)

title: Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) Manager
job_description:
Reporting to the Senior Financial Manager you will oversee all Financial Planning and Analysis activities of OnPoint.

1. Financial Planning:
• Lead the development of the company's long-term financial plans and forecasts (3 to 5 years), ensuring alignment with strategic goals and OKR.
• Build relevant financial models and collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather pertinent data and insights for accurate financial projections.
• Assess and communicate potential risks and opportunities that may impact financial performance.

2. Budgeting and Forecasting:
• Oversee the annual budgeting process, working closely with department heads to establish realistic and achievable financial targets.
• Continuously monitor and update 12 month rolling forecasts, providing timely and accurate variance analysis.
• Develop key performance indicators (KPIs) to track financial performance against budget and forecasts.

3. Strategic Financial Analysis:
• Conduct in-depth financial analyses to support strategic decision-making by senior management.
• Evaluate investment opportunities, mergers, and acquisitions collaborating closely with the Strategy team.
• Provide insights into market trends, industry benchmarks, and competitor analyses.

4. Financial Reporting:
• Lead the preparation and analysis of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports and presentation for Management and Board of Directors.
• Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to track business performance against financial goals and OKR.

5. IPO Readiness:
• Work closely with executive leadership to prepare financial models and analyses required for the IPO process.
• Ensure compliance with regulatory and reporting requirements for public companies.
• Collaborate with external auditors and legal teams to facilitate a smooth transition to a public company.

6. Team Leadership:
• Manage and mentor a team of financial analysts, fostering a collaborative and high-performance culture.
• Ensure the professional development of team members through training and skill-building initiatives.
• Drive efficiency and effectiveness within the FP&A team, optimizing processes and workflows.
requirements:

• Excellent financial modeling and analytical skills.
• Excellent communication and presentation abilities, with the capacity to convey complex financial concepts to diverse audiences.

• Ability to effectively make decisions with limited time and information
• Achieve results through influence, persuasion, collaboration, and relationship building

• Big 4 advisory/audit background / CFA is a plus
• FP&A experience

The Policy and Legislation Program Officer is responsible for development and execution of ENV’s legislative and policy advocacy program.

• Research and provide inputs on drafting laws and legislation upon requests from the ENV Management Board and/or Policy and Legislation Program Manager

• Work with the Wildlife Crime Unit on major cases requiring support or involvement of decision-makers in reaching a successful outcome


Additional Tasks
• Maintain an up to date law library including English and Vietnamese copies of all laws relevant to wildlife protection and a summary document highlighting the main importance of each law
• Maintain and develop the contact list of key policy makers and government partners to keep the list updated in close cooperation with the CPA department contact database
• Coordinate production and distribution of the quarterly Wildlife Crime Bulletin
• Produce monthly report, monthly donor report, and other reports upon request of the ENV Management Board and/or Policy and Legislation Program Manager

This position communicates with customers to bring resolution to unpaid accounts. He/She works to improve cash flow, minmize delinquincy, reduce Days Sales Outstanding and limit bad debt exposure through customer interaction. This position identifies and prioritizes issues impacting payment. He/She overcomes customer objections regarding payments, assists them in understanding account terms, and uses payment options and negotiation skills to arrange payments.

title: Senior Cost Controller II
job_description:
I. Costing management

-Set up standard cost for purchased materials & produced products

-Closely monitor standard & actual purchased & production costs. Timely track & analyze deviation of standard cost, be able to explain deviation, impact to the business.

-Fully understand BOM calculation, be able to detect error and fix before activating the costs.

-Ensure production orders are timely updated and closed.

-Identify cost issues (e.g. yield loss, gap between BOM and Actual, high sundry cost, etc.) and coordinate with Production, BOM Controllers for proper action to improve level of control on costing management.

II.BOM controlling (Advanced)

-Follow up CR system to update JC (BOM, Route) relate to consumption, yield, mpc, process...

-Be an important backup of Data Manager to create new item-configuration, create new operations, create JC to based on flow chart...

-Consolidation of BOM explosion on group level.

III. Reporting & Budgeting

-Prepare and analysis monthly CM report.

-Prepare monthly production deviation and sundry report, recognize area of concerns for prober attention and verification.

-Follow up, timely and precisely calculate monthly savings impact on financial statements, provide the early identification of problem areas (if any). Join monthly savings meeting, can lead the meeting where necessary.

-Participate in yearly budget. Take an important part in coordinating and verifying targets of other departments (material prices- purchasing/sourcing, yield- QA, productivity-Production, etc.).

-Preparation of budget contribution margin & other related reports.

IV. Coaching and supporting

-Coach team members (Cost Controller, Senior Cost Controller, BOM Controller) to fulfill tasks and reach higher quality of performance.

-Sound understanding of ERP system (relating to inventory/cost/BOM controlling) to support check and solve issues in difficult circumstances. Define rules, lead customization (System setup).

-Help clarify/answer inquiries related to production costing from other departments (PE, QA, Production, etc.)

-Complicated ad-hoc tasks/reports assigned by manager to meet deadlines with time pressure.

-Backup team members when necessary

V.Others

-Take part in savings/Kaizen/lean projects and help verify savings.

-Effectively utilization of excel skills (Macro, Power Queries…) to build-up templates to facilitate reporting preparation and improve accuracy of the data.

-Effectively communicate and coordinate with other departments in problem solving, daily operation... to ensure work objectives achieved
requirements:
-Graduate from University/ College with major in foreign trade, economic, or finance University , major in foreign trade, economic, or finance.

-At least 03 year experiences in BOM or Cost controlling

-Experience in international/ manufacturing (electronic) company is preferrable. 

-Basic knowledge of accounting work & computer servicing.

-Good at excel spread sheet and word.

-Can use ERP/ Axapta, preferable.

-Fluent in English.

-Good analytical skill.

-Structured and systematic.

-Open minded, committed, dedicated and flexible

title: Pricing Manager – Revenue & Margin Growth (RMG)
job_description:
Main Job Purpose:
• This position is to drive Revenue & Margin growth in Heineken Vietnam in consumer & customer centric 
way.
• This role partners with the Revenue Management APAC in the design & implementation of RM (Revenue 
Management) methodology and tools, capability across Sales and Marketing team to identify Revenue 
opportunities across the following but not limited to:
o Brand Portfolio Pricing (including pricing strategy and execution etc.)
o Price pack architecture (OBPPC, etc.)
o Value Chain Management
• Responsible for RM opportunity identification & implementation on strategic pricing, designing packs 
price architect (OBPPC), and managing the value across the value chains

includes working with Commercial team on long term innovation pack/price architecture with a total 
profit pool lens

within channels x regions to be executed within the year; b) implementation tracking for ongoing project 
reviews

leadership & commercial teams

competitors

Revenue Management) 
• Applying business insights & analytics to achieve business objectives
• Solid Analytical (excel, macro, Power BI) skills 
• Revenue management experience preferred in the consumer goods industry 
• Understand the context, applying critical thinking and present the solution thoroughly 

Skills: 
• Understanding key elements of revenue management (Pricing strategy, price pack architecture, value 
chain)
• Ability to structure work-streams overcoming ambiguity (e.g lack of availability of complete data sets)

• In-depth understanding of various analyses tools (macro, excel etc), techniques (price elasticity, cross 
elasticity,...)

ownership from brief to delivery 
• Growth mindset with can do attitude.

title: Station Manager Assistant
job_description:
Are you a proactive collaborator with organizational/planning skills? Do you enjoy managing workforce, R&D mindset, and organizational activities? Then you are the Station Manager Assistant we are looking for!

How does your job as Station Manager Assistant at Rijk Zwaan Vietnam look like? 
As Station Manager Assistant you are part of our Research & Development team, with specific responsibility for supporting the Station Manager to carry out the operation and management of all activities at our R&D Station in Don Duong, Lam Dong. You play an important role in supporting the Station Manager in coordinate/assign works for employees working at the Station, monitoring production activities and report to the Station Manager regularly to keep the workflow smooth and efficiently. This entails the following:
• Making plans for managing operational activities at the R&D Station (production plan per crop for 5-year, events plan for VTO trial from sales team, worker plan, materials forecast, maintenance plan)
• Coordinating and monitoring operational activities as well as manage worker, material supplier, … (Assign works and Coordinate workers within Station (together with Trial assistant) for activities such as fertilizer mix and apply, spraying, laydown stem, twist, harvesting, destroy, cleaning GH/field, substrate, seedling take care, …)
• Discussing and reporting to Station Manager on regular basis (weekly) about crops status, materials, …
• Supporting other colleagues with events organizing at the Station
requirements:
*Your contribution:
You are a strong communicator with a high degree of motivation and enthusiasm. As proactive collaborator you are resourceful, and you support the Station Manager in managing operational and management activities at our R&D Station. With your organizational, planning skills, you could contribute to make planning for production activities such as managing crops yearly, station maintenance, human resources management, supply chain management or events. Given the nature of this position, you are open to communicate with different stakeholders and you also speak English fluently. In addition, we can find the following on your resume:
• A bachelor or an university degree in agriculture and some relevant work experiences in the horticulture industry.
• At least 3 years of experience in agriculture, especially in mid tech/high tech is an advantage.
• Good organizational skills.
• Good analytical and interpersonal skills.
• Preferably knowledge of and experience with operating in an international environment.
• Be able to adjust and control Irrigation system in Greenhouse

*What can you expect from us?
As Station Manager Assistant you will be part of the team of Rijk Zwaan Vietnam. The team consists of Product Development Specialists, Marketing Specialist, R&D,… colleagues who are working together to develop new varieties for our customers. We have our own Trial Station in Lam Dong and our office in HCMC. Besides a dynamic environment in which you are exposed to new market and product developments as well as international expertise through which you can contribute to food safety and the world food supply, we are happy to offer you:
• A permanent contract for 40 hours a week.
• Market -based salary based on job level and experience.
• Various training opportunities through our Rijk Zwaan Academy.
• A good work/life balance.

*Interested?
Do you recognize yourself and would you like to start as soon as possible?

*Rijk Zwaan: your new employer?
Rijk Zwaan is an international family company with a people-oriented culture. Rijk Zwaan is right at the start of the food chain. We develop vegetable varieties and sell the seeds produced from them globally.
From our strategic position we contribute to the world food supply. Everything we do is about growth. The growth of natural products that we export around the world. The growth of our company and above all the growth of our people: we give you every opportunity to use your own initiative and achieve your full potential.

title: Retail Client Specialist Vietnam
job_description:
Are you a proactive collaborator with commercial insight? Do you enjoy following consumer market developments, understanding client needs and building trustworthy and enduring relationships with major fresh produce chain partners? Then you are the Chain Specialist we are looking for!

*How does your job as Retail Client Specialist at Rijk Zwaan Vietnam look like? 
As Retail Client Specialist you are part of our sales and product development team, with specific responsibility for building relationships with vegetable supply chain partners such as major retail companies, trading companies, food processors and large growers. Moreover, you fulfil an essential role in carrying out market research, consumer testing of new varieties/concepts, following complex market dynamics and developments, and initiating new business developments together and in accordance with our Client Managers. You share knowledge about the value chain, consumer trends and work closely together with the Vietnamese sales and product development team. Also, you participate at major national exhibitions and attend seminars based on business needs. Finally, you will become responsible for several clients. This entails the following:
• Developing trustworthy relationships with the chain/retail clients
• Acquiring a thorough understanding of the needs and requirements of the chain/retail clients
• Serving as contact person between the chain clients and the Vietnamese crop and client team of Rijk Zwaan
requirements:
*Your contribution:
You are a strong communicator with a high degree of motivation and enthusiasm. As proactive collaborator you are resourceful and you support the Client Managers in developing new business concepts for the value chain. With your commercial insight, social skills and team mentality you can establish and strongly maintain long-term relationships in the value chain for vegetables in Vietnam. Given the nature of this position, you are open to travel nationally and you also speak English fluently. In addition, we can find the following on your resume:
• A completed bachelor or master degree, in the field of Agriculture and/or Business
• At least 2-4 years of relevant working experience
• Knowledge of and experience with commercial (producer/buyer) dynamics
• Preferably knowledge of and experience with operating in an international environment

*What can you expect from us?
As Retail Client Specialist you will be part of the team of Rijk Zwaan Vietnam. The team consists of Product Development Specialist, Marketing… colleagues who are working together to develop new varieties for our customers. We have our own Trial Station in Da Lat and our office in HCMC. The Chain Specialist will play an important role in developing relationships, organizing consumer market testing and initiating new business developments to contribute in sustaining and growing our business to achieve long-term success in Vietnam. Besides a dynamic environment in which you are exposed to new market and product developments as well as international expertise through which you can contribute to food safety and the world food supply, we are happy to offer you:
• A permanent contract for 40 hours a week
• Market -based salary based on job level and experience
• Various training opportunities through our Rijk Zwaan Academy
• A good work/life balance

*Interested?
Do you recognize yourself and would you like to start as soon as possible? 

*Rijk Zwaan: your new employer?
Rijk Zwaan is an international family company with a people-oriented culture. Rijk Zwaan is right at the start of the food chain. We develop vegetable varieties and sell the seeds produced from them globally.
From our strategic position we contribute to the world food supply. Everything we do is about growth. The growth of natural products that we export around the world. The growth of our company and above all the growth of our people: we give you every opportunity to use your own initiative and achieve your full potential.

*** Role Purpose

This position is accountable for managing a team within an assigned region/market to deliver the sales objectives and ensure profitable sales growth of the defined territory by promoting the benefits of Coats's range of products and services products. This will be done in close collaboration with functional colleagues e.g. Technical Services, Global Accounts, Customer Services and supply chain

The individual is expected to work closely with the Head of Sales/ Commercial Director to implement the short to medium term strategy by motivating and managing the assigned sales team to drive sales conversion and grow market shares in the target segments

The incumbent is responsible for assisting Head of Sales/Sales Manager to build the capability of the assigned team through coaching and active promotion of the Coats Commercial Academy programmers and ensuring the team is adhering to Commercial Excellence principles and company policies. 

*** Principal Accountabilities and Key Activities

Commercial Responsibilities: 
• To develop territory plans and visit schedules for sales executives and ensure that customers are serviced in accordance with the principles of customer segmentation to ensure we focus the resources on the customers with the greatest growth potential. 
• To initiate and build relationships with senior management in existing and potential customers so that Coats can develop and expand the customer contact map to ensure we have access to the key decision makers.
• To communicate with other departments internally so that Issues/challenges/opportunities/product innovation can be prioritized and resolved so that sales/ service targets can be met.
• To monitor and coach assigned sales executives in the field aligned to the sales competency framework and Commercial Academy programmes to identify relevant training and development needs for their team
• Understand the market dynamics, trends and emerging needs of customers and translate this into actionable insights which are shared proactively using the CSX CRM platform.
• Deliver collection achievement vs. target as well as the intended DSO

Marketing and Communication: 
• To provide market intelligence/insights on both customers and competitors so to support senior management on developing strategies/tactics to enhance business growth
• To work with marketing team re co-branding, digital events etc in order to increase brand awareness for non-Coats users, and enhance brand goodwill among existing users.
• Actively support key strategic customer meetings to promote the benefits of Coats product, service & digital offer 
• Support global projects and innovations in the local market.

People Development: 
• Develop and coach the sales team in accordance with competency profiles and aligned to the Commercial Academy Training programmes
• Build capability and consistency of the team by training and developing and providing coordination to the relevant stakeholder of GA, Technical services , Customer service and O2C team. 
• Encourage and engage Sales team to develop a growth mindset based on proactive actions to enhance performance and improve results.
• Drive engagement, motivation and recognition within the team to build accountability to achieve their goals.
• Actively support and promote the Commercial Academy training modules with their sales team to build a consistent way of working aligned to the overall sales capability development plan
• To ensure formal appraisal are given to each sales executive to review every 6 months and 12 month

• Outstanding communicator, able to rapidly build and sustain relationship at all levels within the organization based on trust and consistent delivery to expectations
• Financial and business awareness with good numerical and analytical skills 
• Innovative self-starter with the ability to take ownership and set goals and priorities

title: Audio Visual Techinican & Secondary Academic Assistant
job_description:
Cognita Schools are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people and expects all staff, volunteers, and other third parties to share this commitment. Safer recruitment practices and pre-employment background checks will be undertaken before any appointment is confirmed. Appointment is subject to an enhanced Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check for regulated activity (if the candidate has lived in the UK) and/or criminal/police or equivalent background checks for all other countries inhabited (irrespective of whether you worked in those countries).

Position Objective:
The role of the Technical Assistant is to oversee the operational and strategic management of the AV systems, theater, film equipment/green screen room, black box, and theater changing rooms, including events, functions, performances, assemblies, and activities. This includes setting up and taking down equipment, and managing equipment checkout for curricular classes and events for Theatre, Film, and Broadcasting, as well as working alongside staff and students to support secondary events.

Working closely with the Arts department and other teaching staff, the Technical Assistant will support curriculum delivery. They will coordinate events and provide technical expertise and support to help ensure the theater, black box, green screen room, and film room are exciting and vibrant spaces for audiences and student artists. The Technical assistant is also responsible for training teaching staff and coaching students on how to use technical equipment and designated spaces, enabling teaching staff and students (with supervision) to use the theater independently within their programs. 

Working across the secondary school includes the set up and support for assemblies or events which require AV. These include but are not limited to assemblies, grade level events, house events, SET and student led events. 

Inherent in the position is the ability to undertake physical work requiring bending, and lifting of heavy equipment. These physical demands are representative of the position and are essential in order to successfully perform the essential functions of the job.

Responsibilities:
Specific Duties
The duties and responsibilities of the Technical Assistant position include but are not limited to:
1. Curriculum support
• The Technical Assistant is responsible for the following:
• Work collaboratively with teachers and other teaching assistants as required.
• Supporting the practical aspects of the Theatre and Film courses throughout the School.
• Contributing to the smooth running of the Department and furthering its excellent reputation. 
2. Management and Coordination of Theater and Film spaces and Equipment Management 
2.1 School use/functions: 
• Coordinate the availability of the Auditorium and rooms for school events, functions, performances, and productions, in consultation with key school personnel. 
• Develop and maintain a booking calendar and schedule theater and film spaces
• Provide onsite management of all auditorium and film space use 
• Maintain an up-to-date knowledge of regulations relating to the Film and Theatre Spaces including copyright and licensing (including merchandising), child protection, and workplace health and safety requirements. 
3. Technical Support 
• Implement, operate, and manage the technical systems for the Theatre and Film, including audio, visual and lighting, film, and broadcasting equipment. 
• Provide expertise and assistance to the school staff and students, in the use of film and theater equipment and technical systems. 
• Oversee the development and training of student teams to assist with stage/set management, film and broadcasting, and the operation of audio, visual, and lighting equipment for school events. 
• Support and assist teachers who use the theater and film facilities for training purposes by providing any training necessary to enable teachers to use the spaces independently as part of their teaching program. 
• Provide a hands-on approach, advice, and support in the acquisition, manufacture, and development of props.
• Manage checkout and collection of film and theater equipment for curricular and event use. Tracking and taking action as necessary for any late or damaged equipment returns.

4. Financial 
• Track costs and expenditures for Theater and Film for both curricular and co-curricular purposes 
• Source and order resources and equipment as required

5. Information Management and Record Keeping 
• Maintain reliable and accurate electronic and paper-based records. 
• Maintain an accurate inventory and replacement cycle of equipment for film and theater

6. Maintenance 
• In consultation with the relevant staff, oversee the maintenance of theater, film, and broadcast equipment maintenance on the campus.

Occupational: Child Protection Health and Safety 
• Undertake and apply Child Protection and Occupational Safety and Health practices in the workplace to ensure the safety of self and others. 
• Undertake professional development and training relative to the appointment. 

7. AV Specific 
• Provide feedback, research, and recommend AV best practices within the school.
• Vendor management, arrange for repairs, manage and implement new AV projects.
• Communicate, plan, set up and operate light and sound systems, projectors & computer systems for events on campus that require AV
• Maintain, troubleshoot, and support teachers with AV including projectors
• Maintain and update AV inventory records and conduct regular audits.
• Assist and teach teaching staff to use AV resources when required
• Maintain the integrity, security, and availability of AV systems.
• Assist with the evaluation and procurement of AV equipment & software
• Perform other duties as assigned.
• Oversee the iLearn space including connecting projectors/ video calls through Skype/ I-learn room when required.

This job description indicates the general nature and level of work expected. It is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities required by the incumbent. Incumbents may be asked to perform other duties as required.

If in the course of carrying out the duties of the role, the job holder identifies any instance that a child is suffering or likely to suffer significant harm either at school or at home, s/he must report any concerns to the School’s Designated Safeguarding Lead or to the Head of School or indeed to the Regional CEO or Safeguarding Manager - Asia so that a referral can be made accordingly to the statutory services.

title: Sales Executive
job_description:
**** Role Purpose:
The incumbent of this role is the face of the Company to the customers. Primary responsibility of this incumbent will be to manage and develop a portfolio of vendors to maximize revenue and margin for Coats. 

Retaining relationships with the vendors and growing SOW by selling the full portfolio of Coats products and services aligned to the needs of the vendors is a key deliverable of the incumbent. Gathering market intelligence regarding demand trends and applying this to the demand forecasting process to ensure we can meet the customer requirements for product supply whilst optimizing stock levels and working capital

In addition, the incumbent of this role is responsible for business development by acquiring new sales with vendors not currently supplied by Coats. Using a structured approach to Prospecting and Digital selling to target vendors, identify opportunities and securing profitable new business is the key deliverable for this role. 

This is a dedicated customer management role to sales and does not have any direct people management responsibility, however the incumbent needs to collaborate with a range of multi-functional colleagues to drive the customer agenda.

**** Role Responsibilities:

Increase Market Share: 
• Identify new opportunities to sustain business growth in the defined territory with a portfolio of existing customers.
• Evaluate the market landscape to identify potential new customers for Coats to approach aligned to the local market development strategy for Coats
• Growth with customers in priority segments projected to grow ahead of the market and growing share of wallet (SOW) is a priority focus
• Use the principles of Value Verification to defend pricing strategies and maintain share in a highly competitive environment
• Collaboration with the GA team to increase the level of conversion of specified business with GA customers with the local vendors.
• Support the prospecting process to deliver new business opportunities to Coats to support the defined growth strategy for the market 
• Audit compliance to GA specifications by vendors and provide market intelligence back to the GA team
• Actively use CSX Dynamics to manage and report all new business opportunities as they progress through the purchase funnel.
• Provide market intelligence to and support to the Global Accounts team to work on securing new specification opportunities from new brands

Provide day to day service to Customers and engage prospects: 
• Help customers to pick the right thread for the right garment, assist with colour matching, lead price negotiations and conduct regular follow up on collections.
• Maintain regular contact with customers virtually (phone, email, video) to complement face to face meetings in accordance with the service levels expected for key customer segments.
• Provide training and support to customers and actively promote the use of digital portals for order placement, and other digitally enabled activities.
• Liaison with customer service and logistics team to ensure on time delivery to customers.
• Handle complaints regarding quality/application.
• Update CRM (Dynamics CSX), on a daily basis for existing business and prospects
• Deliver collection achievement vs. target as well as the intended DSO.
• Liaise with credit control officer to work closely with customers in order to collect the payment on time.
• Develop and establish contacts with potential prospects using digital and direct communication channels.

Support Sales Planning, Forecast and Projection effectively: 
• Contribute to the demand planning process and be accountable for ongoing improvements in forecast accuracy. 
• Conduct monthly rolling forecast review for demand planning of raw materials/finished goods stock.

Promote New Products/Global Services/Digital Marketing: 
• Coordinate with Marketing/Supply Chain for NPD launches locally
• Work with Technical team to promote technical services to existing customers to deliver tangible benefits (Efficiency savings) to customers and upselling opportunities for Coats
• Jointly work with TS team to promote and upgrade product. Offer efficiency drive at customer shop floor
• Actively build contacts and relationships using digital channels in collaboration with marketing

title: Learning and Development Manager
job_description:
- Develops and implements a learning strategy and program that are aligned with the organization’s objectives 
- Evaluate individual and organizational development needs
Implement various learning methods companywide (e.g. coaching, job-shadowing, online training)
- Design and deliver e-learning courses, workshops and other trainings
- Assess the success of development plans and help employees make the most of learning opportunities
- Help managers develop their team members through career pathing
- Track budgets and negotiate contracts
- Stay abreast of the latest developments in learning trends, changes in learning theory, and developments in learning technologies 
- Hire and oversee training and L&D
requirements:
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE NEEDED
KIẾN THỨC, KỸ NĂNG VÀ KINH NGHIỆM CẦN THIẾT

Knowledge: 
- Human resource management: familiarity with HR practices, performance management, and talent development strategies. 
- Organizational development: awareness of organizational culture, change management, and leadership development techniques. 
 
Skills: 
- Needs assessment: Identifying skill gaps, training needs, and learning objectives. 
- Program development: Designing and developing engaging and effective training programs. 
- Instructional delivery: Delivering training through various methods, including facilitated sessions, eLearning, and coaching. 
- Evaluation and measurement: Assessing the effectiveness of training programs and measuring their impact on employee performance. 
- Budgeting and resource management: Planning and managing training budgets and resources effectively. 
- Communication and collaboration: Communicating effectively with diverse audiences and collaborating with stakeholders.

job_description:

• Program management in market

- Track and report overall effectiveness of the program through specific KPIs

• Excellent communication skills and ability to coordinate work across many functions and in different geographies

title: Category Manager (Household_Personalcare)
job_description:
- Role and Scope of the Task
The role of the Category Manager is:
1. to source products at the lowest possible cost price and best terms
2. find and develop suppliers who are prepared long term to develop their products and the supply chain to our requirements
3. create and source highly attractive private label products that are equal or better in quality than comparable brands
4. support the process of defining and constantly adjusting the assortment
5. monitor the market and propose the most competitive sales prices

The CM bears responsibility for the entire life cycle of his category of products: from sourcing (brands) or inception (private label products) to quality control and eventually sales.

- The CM is a Senior Manager whose role is critical in helping to define the company’s customer proposition as far as products are concerned. 

He works within a team of CM’s, and he should make readily use of their expertise.

In his work the CM will aim to promote the key parts of the “hard discount concept”:
• Lowest possible sales prices
• Key role of private label products which should be of excellent quality against comparable brands
• Limited and yet most attractive assortment
• Achieve efficient, long term and suitable supply chains with suppliers 
• Cost consciousness and efficiency of work processes

The Category Manager adheres to and endeavors to foster the company philosophy as it pertains to staff: efficient and hard working in a friendly environment that is characterized by mutual respect of all associates.


- Reporting Lines and Authority
• On professional matters the CM reports to the Chief Purchasing Officer.
• At a disciplinary level the CM is accountable to the Chief Executive Officer.
• Purchasing assistants report to the CM on professional matters

The CM has authority to sign Purchasing Contracts along with the CPO.
His limit for incurring company expenses is defined in a separate company procedure.


 
- Specific tasks
In his daily work the Category Manager will execute the following tasks:
• Be an expert in his category of products
• Observe the market (competitors) to constantly have a comprehensive view on products and product developments
• Carry out regular store visits: own stores, competitors including specific local formats such as local supermarkets, Mom and Pop stores, wet markets
• Support the process of defining and constantly adjusting the assortment
• Negotiate lowest possible cost prices and best possible terms (a.o. payment terms)
• Based on the market situation propose private label products
• Find the best suitable suppliers for brand and private label products
• Along with suppliers develop private label products and source them
• Develop stable and long-term relationships with suitable suppliers
• Monitor the quality of products, most critically private label products, by
o Being involved in quality control in the warehouses: provide guidance and issue product sheets to enable receiving and regional purchasing to exercise QC
o Carrying out regular quality controls himself (tastings with CM’s or senior management)
o Supervise external quality control through QC organizations (laboratories)
• Carry out price surveys in competitor stores
• Advise and monitor price surveys that are carried out by external or internal people
• Ensure sales prices are at all times at the lowest sales price level
• Prepare and participate in a ca. monthly meeting, the General Purchasing Meeting, in which he will lay out his proposals for products and sales prices.
• Prepare and participate in a ca. weekly meeting, the Weekly Sales Meeting, in which short term and operational matters will be decided: product introductions, sales price changes, promotional activities (launch and analysis), a few other day to day matters that may be brought forward by Central Purchasing or Sales
• Prepare and check key internal documents: reports, weekly assortment information to regional offices (warehouses), weekly circular to stores
• Advise his line manager and the senior management of the company on anything as it pertains to our customer offering

Furthermore, the CM may be instructed by his line manager to carry out any other reasonable tasks than those described above.

- Performance measure
The CM’s work overall and his development is being assessed by the CPO. Besides regular exchange with the CPO, the CM should be subject to a formal assessment every half year. 

More specifically he is being measured in his category of products on the development of:
• Margin
• Sales
• Price gap to a panel of competitors
requirements:
- University/ College degree.
- Good planning, organizing & time management skills.
- Good communication skills.
- Detailed oriented and able to handle multitasks.
- Strong leadership and relationship management.
- Good command of spoken English.

13th-month bonus (fixed)

2. Quản lý hoạt động Marketing hiệu suất (Performance marketing)

3. Nhiệm vụ truyền thông thương hiệu doanh nghiệp – Phối hợp Marcom tập đoàn

- Quản lý và phát triển các chỉ số thương hiệu của Công ty: từ các chỉ số chung về thương hiệu (NPS, BEI,…) cho tới các chỉ số trên kỹ thuật số (thảo luận, sentiment, follower, impression, engagement…)
- Quản lý hình ảnh, thông điệp truyền thông trên các tài tài sản thương hiệu (bao gồm hữu hình và vô hình) của công ty
- Quan hệ báo chí và xử lý khủng hoảng 
- Định vị thương hiệu VPBankS được phủ sóng rộng rãi tới khách hàng mục tiêu, công chúng và các đối tượng liên quan
- Các chỉ số thương hiệu được đo lường, đánh giá và có sự phát triển hàng năm 
- Hình ảnh, nội dung các kênh thương hiệu được xây dựng nổi bật, phù hợp với định vị thương hiệu

title: Marketing Manager (Global Retail Industry)
job_description:
The role of the Marketing Manager is:
1. Building marketing plans incorporating all communications channels in both online and offline
2. Implement and monitor all store marketing activities including POSM production, promotion campaign, or content of social media 
3. Prepare monthly expenditure reports for advertisements, promotion events, and all types of expenses involved in product marketing
4. Work closely with the agency to make sure projects deploy on time with the right quality
5. Knowledge of conceptualizing product design and setting specifications

Specific tasks 
In his daily work the Marketing Manager will execute the following tasks:
• Develop campaign tactics to get the word out about our company, product, concept and drive qualified traffic to our front door
• Deploy successful marketing campaigns and own their implementation from ideation to execution
• Experiment with a variety of paid acquisition channels like flyer/leaflet, content curation, event management, publicity, social media, campaigns, copywriting, performance analysis
• Produce valuable and engaging content for our website/FB/Zalo that attracts and converts our target groups
• Build strategic relationships and partner with printing house, agencies and vendors
• Measure and report on the performance of marketing campaigns, gain insight and assess against goals
• Analyze consumer behavior and advertising campaigns accordingly
• Understand customer needs and requirements through design briefs in term of Private label packaging label packaging

- Experience in the retail industry
- Good command of English

1. Hậu cần
• Đảm bảo hỗ trợ hậu cần và hệ thống hậu cần được thực hiện đúng quy định, hiệu quả, kịp thời

• Nắm vững các quy định quản lý kho của tổ chức/của cơ quan chức năng để kiểm tra/giám sát/hướng dẫn các kho/đơn vị
• Hỗ trợ các phụ trách kho thực hiện nghiệp vụ quản lý kho theo đúng quy định
• Kiểm tra việc thực hiện quy trình quản lý kho của các đơn vị/các kho
• Tổ chức, kiểm tra, quản lý việc dán nhãn phụ (nếu có), đóng hàng chính xác, kịp thời

• Theo dõi, kiểm tra, lấy biên bản giao nhận và làm thanh toán chi phí vận chuyển
• Hỗ trợ trực kho cho thủ kho BK HN khi thủ kho nghỉ
• Hỗ trợ/giám sát/theo dõi việc nhận hàng (từ nhà cung cấp lớn, khi hàng về nhiều, khi nhận hàng trực tiếp từ nhà cung cấp hoặc từ forwarder)
• Hoàn thiện báo cáo kho theo đúng quy định (chính xác, đầy đủ, đúng hạn)
• Lưu báo cáo kho theo đúng quy định phục vụ cho kiểm tra/kiểm toán
• Hướng dẫn quy trình quản lý kho khi có yêu cầu
• Quản lí, giám sát kho vận

2. Mua sắm
• Thực hiện việc mua sắm cho các đơn vị theo đúng quy định, hiệu quả, kịp thời (lấy báo giá, tổng hợp báo giá, hoàn thiện hợp đồng, theo dõi việc giao nhận hàng và làm thanh toán cho các nhà cung cấp)
• Tìm kiếm nhà cung cấp, đánh giá các nhà cung cấp, xây dựng/cập nhật cơ sở dữ liệu nhà cung cấp.
• Tư vấn cho các đội về mua sắm, hậu cần và kiểm tra báo giá khi nhận được yêu cầu.
• Chỉnh sửa, soạn thảo hợp đồng/thanh lý hợp đồng, lấy ý kiến của thành viên liên quan trước khi trình ký và quản hợp đồng/thanh lý hợp đồng.
• Lưu các sản phẩm mẫu, chứng từ mua sắm đầy đủ, đúng quy định
• Hướng dẫn quy trình mua sắm khi có yêu cầu và giám sát các đơn vị thực hiện việc mua sắm

3. Khác
• Theo dõi và kiểm nghiệm hàng hóa theo quy định
• Theo dõi và hiểu chuẩn các thiết bị tại kho theo quy định
• Trực thay thủ kho tại Hà Nội (khi có yêu cầu)
